properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 11:15AM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS POSSIBLE IN THE CASCADES FRIDAY
THROUGH SATURDAY...

.The first in a long series of strong weather disturbances will
impact the Pacific Northwest beginning Friday morning, bringing
heavy snow to the Cascades Friday and Saturday. At this time the
heaviest snow looks to fall during the Friday afternoon through
Saturday morning time period before decreasing to light to
moderate snow showers late Saturday and Saturday night. This is
the first of several periods of heavy snow in the Washington and
Oregon Cascades through the middle part of next week.

* WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds possible. Storm total snow
accumulations between 2 and 3 feet, along with wind gusts
between 40 and 50 mph are possible.

* WHERE...Lane County Cascades.

* WHEN...Friday morning through Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel across the mountains could be very difficult to
impossible with periods of near blizzard conditions possible
from Friday morning through most of Saturday. The combination of
strong winds and heavy snow could also result in downed trees
and powerlines, and local power outages.
properties.instruction:
Anyone with travel or back country plans in the Lane County
Cascades should stay current with the latest weather information
on this developing winter storm

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
